thread.title: Woman says United Airlines is at fault for her dog's death
thread.title_full: Woman says United Airlines is at fault for her dog's death

title: Woman says United Airlines is at fault for her dog's death
text: show ad Heartbroken Oregon woman blames United Airlines for her beloved golden retriever death after he arrived in Portland 'non-responsive' 20 HOURS later than expected Kathleen Considine wrote a Facebook post concerning her seven-year-old dog Jacob - and the way he was allegedly treated by United Airlines She says Jacob was scheduled to travel from Detroit to Portland with a one-hour layover in Chicago Claims Jacob landed in Chicago and didn't fit on the plane to Portland, so he was kept in a kennel for 20 hours until the next flight he could fit on Says that United Airlines didn't let Considine's mother send food with the dog Also claims Jacob was 'disoriented and non-responsive' in Portland and was told by a United agent the dog may have been given medication Considine wrote that her pet was taken to an emergency vet and 'he was pronounced dead after 8 min of CPR' Airline says it 'worked to ensure Jacob's comfort throughout his entire journey and he showed no signs of distress nor behave in a way' suggesting he was ill
